questiontext.text: A patient came to RSGMP with complaints of difficulty chewing due to loss and need a denture. Intra-oral examination revealed missing teeth 15,16,17,18,22,23,25,26,27,28,31,32,34,35,36,37,38. The remaining teeth are in good condition. What is the diagnosis of Kennedy's classification of the maxilla?

What is the kennedy classification diagnosis for the lower jaw?

name.text: REMEDIAL UJIAN AKHIR MK. BLOK GNATOLOGI 1 KELAS INTERNASIONAL

questiontext.text: A 63-year-old woman came to Dental Hospital complaining of difficulty chewing due to tooth loss. Intra-oral examination found complete tooth loss in upper and lower jaw. Examination related to the patient's mental attitude found that the patient was rational and trusted the doctor who treated him and was quick to adapt. Which category of House classification fit into the case ?

name.text: REMEDIAL UJIAN AKHIR MK. BLOK GNATOLOGI 1 KELAS INTERNASIONAL

questiontext.text: A patient came in dental hospital with the complaint of difficulty chewing due to missing a lot of teeth and need a denture. Intra-oral examination revealed tooth loss: 15,16,17,18,25,26,27,28,36,46. The remaining teeth are in good condition. The dentist decided to manufacture a metal frame removable denture. What is the most appropriate denture support design for the case of the lower jaw ?

questiontext.text: A 30-year-old woman came to the dentist complaining of embarrassment due to missing front teeth. The dentist then do anamneses, one of which asked the woman's occupation. What is the purpose of the question?

answer.text: To determine the relationship history of systemic disease with the patient's occupation
To consider the relationship between diet and patient occupation
To find out the patient's desire to make dentures
To find out the patient's history of tooth loss
To consider the selection of the type of denture to be used

name.text: REMEDIAL UJIAN AKHIR MK. BLOK GNATOLOGI 1 KELAS INTERNASIONAL

questiontext.text: A 26-year-old woman came to the Dental Hospital with complaints of difficulty opening her mouth. Intra-oral examination: Inter-incisal distance of upper and lower teeth was 24 mm, Type of bite edge to edge. The dentist will fill in the medical record according to the patient's condition. What is the value of the mouth opening that must be filled by the dentist?

name.text: REMEDIAL UJIAN AKHIR MK. BLOK GNATOLOGI 1 KELAS INTERNASIONAL

questiontext.text: A 25-year-old woman came to the Dental Hospital with complaints of difficulty opening her mouth and pain in her face when her mouth was forced to open wider. Intra-oral examination: Mouth opening 10 mm. |What muscle is most likely to be affected and needs to be examined for the above case?

name.text: REMEDIAL UJIAN AKHIR MK. BLOK GNATOLOGI 1 KELAS INTERNASIONAL

questiontext.text: A 25-year-old woman came to the Dental Hospital with complaints of facial pain, especially in the morning. Extra-oral examination: No pain during palpation of the right and left masseter, the dentist will fill out the medical record according to the patient's condition. What is the appropriate muscle palpation technique for the above case?

answer.text: Palpate with two fingers, duration 1 second, and pressure 1 kg
Palpate with one finger, duration 2 seconds, and pressure 1 kg
Palpate with three fingers, duration 1 second, and pressure 0.5 kg
Palpate with one finger, duration 1 second, and pressure 0.5 kg
Palpate with two fingers, duration 3 seconds, and pressure 0.5 kg

The dentist will make a metal frame removable partial denture and conduct surveys on the study model to determine the design of the denture. What type of surveyor rod was used for the block out procedure in this case?

questiontext.text: A 60-year-old man came to the Dental Hospital with complaints of difficulty chewing food because he had no teeth. The patient wants a new dentures. On intra-oral examination, bony prominences were seen in the maxillary labial area. What is the appropriate preprosthetic procedure in the above case?

name.text: REMEDIAL UJIAN AKHIR MK. BLOK GNATOLOGI 1 KELAS INTERNASIONAL

questiontext.text: A 60-year-old woman came to the General Hospital with complaints of pain in the upper front gums. Already wearing dentures and they are loose. Want to make dentures that are comfortable to use. Intra-oral examination: the maxilla is fully edentulous, there is swelling of the gums. The mandibular remaining teeth 31, 32, 33, 43, 42 and 41. What is the initial treatment for the above case?

answer.text: Instructions not to use his old denture for a while

At this visit the dentist will perform a physiological impression on the patient. What is the material used for printing in the case?

questiontext.text: A 29-year-old woman came with complaints of difficulty chewing because many teeth had been extracted and she wanted to make a denture. At this visit, the dentist will perform a preliminary impression. What is the correct position of the operator towards the patient when performing the mandibular impression in this case?

name.text: REMEDIAL UJIAN AKHIR MK. BLOK GNATOLOGI 1 KELAS INTERNASIONAL

questiontext.text: A 62-year-old woman came to the Dental Hospital with complaints of difficulty chewing and want to make dentures. Intra-oral examination: total edentulus. The dentist will make a complete denture with an acrylic base. After making individual printing spoons, proceed with the border molding stage. What is the purpose of the border molding stage in this case?

answer.text: Record all potential surfaces to support the denture

name.text: REMEDIAL UJIAN AKHIR MK. BLOK GNATOLOGI 1 KELAS INTERNASIONAL

questiontext.text: A 62-year-old woman came to the General Hospital with complaints of difficulty chewing and wanted a denture made. Intra-oral examination, total edentulus of the upper and lower jaw. The dentist will make a complete denture and be approved by the patient. Before casting on the negative prints resulting from physiological impressions, beading and boxing were carried out. What is the purpose of beading and boxing in this case?

answer.text: Maintain the surface that has the potential to support the denture

name.text: REMEDIAL UJIAN AKHIR MK. BLOK GNATOLOGI 1 KELAS INTERNASIONAL

questiontext.text: A woman came to the RSGMP and want to have a new removable denture. During this visit, the dentist will insert dentures, and perform retention checks and examination of the neutral zone (NZ). What is related to the case above?

answer.text: Identification of NZ starts when creating a record block and when GT tries before becoming GT
Tooth position in NZ RB is less important due to relatively less retention
If the GT RB is inserted, it must remain in place if the mouth is half open & the tip of the tongue fits snugly in front of the anterior teeth of the RB
The tongue when relaxed should be below the occlusal surface
Rule of thumb: GT RB is usually stable when using wide teeth buccally or labially without pressing the cheeks and lips

name.text: REMEDIAL UJIAN AKHIR MK. BLOK GNATOLOGI 1 KELAS INTERNASIONAL

questiontext.text: Unstable base could be due to insufficient GT fit, or unfavorable movement or shape of the denture-bearing tissue. In examining the extent of the denture base, several assessments were carried out. What to check according to the scenario?

answer.text: Under-extension is seen in the mouth when the sulcus depth is seen to be deeper than the GT flank
Correction of over-extension by increasing wing length
An important posterior extension of the GT is the labial frenulum
Mark overextension: release GT and make sudden movement

name.text: REMEDIAL UJIAN AKHIR MK. BLOK GNATOLOGI 1 KELAS INTERNASIONAL

questiontext.text: In the manufacture of complete dentures, the steps for determining the height of the upper bite rim in the patient's mouth are carried out. What are the requirements of that stage ?

answer.text: The posterior part forms an angle of 90°
The anterior is parallel to Camper's line
22 mm high from the frenulum margin
The posterior part is parallel to the lower bite rim
Anteriorly visible 2 mm from upper lip margin at rest

name.text: REMEDIAL UJIAN AKHIR MK. BLOK GNATOLOGI 1 KELAS INTERNASIONAL

questiontext.text: In the process of measuring the vertical dimensions of the jaw, it turns out that the result is a small Free Way Space. What can happen if this continues ?

name.text: REMEDIAL UJIAN AKHIR MK. BLOK GNATOLOGI 1 KELAS INTERNASIONAL

questiontext.text: Another important step in the manufacture of complete dentures is the determination of the Free Way Space. What is meant by the above steps ?

answer.text: The difference between the distance VDR and VDO
Jaw distance when the teeth are in maximum occlusion
Upper and lower jaw distance at rest
The distance between the maxilla and the mandible at the time of occlusion

name.text: REMEDIAL UJIAN AKHIR MK. BLOK GNATOLOGI 1 KELAS INTERNASIONAL

questiontext.text: In examining the vertical dimension of the occlusion at the time of testing the denture, there are several things that must be done. What should be done during a denture examination according to the scenario?

answer.text: Pay attention to facial proportions, lip posture, and jaw relationship
Patients should not be spoken to when using GT try
His teeth normally don't contact when he speaks except when he says "X"
If the denture DVO tries to overload, the closest speech distance increases
Check the interpupillary distance in relaxed and occluded positions

name.text: REMEDIAL UJIAN AKHIR MK. BLOK GNATOLOGI 1 KELAS INTERNASIONAL

questiontext.text: A 60-year-old female patient came to the General Hospital with a complaint that her dentures were uncomfortable when biting due to poor occlusion. Then the dentist corrected the occlusion by doing selective grinding. What is the law of selective grinding in protrusive motion?

answer.text: Reduce the labial surface of the RB anterior teeth and the palatal surfaces of the RA anterior teeth
No reduction was made to the RA and RB dental cups
Reduce the labial surface of the RA anterior teeth and the palatal surfaces of the RB anterior teeth
Reduce the mesiopalatal slope of the RA canine and the distolabial slope of the RB canine

name.text: REMEDIAL UJIAN AKHIR MK. BLOK GNATOLOGI 1 KELAS INTERNASIONAL

questiontext.text: A 60-year-old female patient came to the General Hospital with complaints that her denture was uncomfortable when biting due to poor occlusion as shown in the picture. The dentist then corrected the occlusion by performing selective grinding. What procedure will be performed in the image below?

answer.text: Grinding the mandibular buccal cusp or deepening the maxillary fossa
Grinding the mandibular buccal cusp or deepening the mandibular fossa
Reduction of maxillary buccal cusp height & mandibular lingual cusp on working side
Grinding the maxillary palatal cusps and deepening the maxillary fossa on the working side

name.text: REMEDIAL UJIAN AKHIR MK. BLOK GNATOLOGI 1 KELAS INTERNASIONAL

questiontext.text: A 60-year-old female patient came to the General Hospital with a complaint that her denture was uncomfortable when biting due to poor occlusion as shown in the picture. The dentist then corrected the occlusion by performing selective grinding. What procedure will be performed in the image below?

answer.text: Grinding the buccal cusp of the lower jaw or deepening the maxillary fossa
Grinding the buccal cusp of the mandible or deepening the mandibular fossa
Grinding the lower lingual cusp or deepening the maxillary fossa

name.text: REMEDIAL UJIAN AKHIR MK. BLOK GNATOLOGI 1 KELAS INTERNASIONAL

questiontext.text: A 60-year-old female patient came to the General Hospital with a complaint that her dentures were uncomfortable when biting due to poor occlusion. Then the dentist corrected the occlusion by doing selective grinding. What is the law of selective grinding in eccentric occlusion?

answer.text: On the working side, the inner slope of the lingual cusp of RB and the inner slope of the buccal cusp of RA
On the working side, the inner slope of the buccal cusp of RA and the inner slope of the lingual cusp of RB
On the balancing side, the inner slope of the lingual cusp of RB and the inner slope of the buccal cusp of RA

name.text: REMEDIAL UJIAN AKHIR MK. BLOK GNATOLOGI 1 KELAS INTERNASIONAL

questiontext.text: In making a record base for complete dentures, the next step a dentist will design for the maxillary model. What is part of these stages ?

questiontext.text: One of the stages in the manufacture of complete dentures is the manufacture of Bite Rim. What is the function of that tool ?

name.text: REMEDIAL UJIAN AKHIR MK. BLOK GNATOLOGI 1 KELAS INTERNASIONAL

questiontext.text: A man goes to the dentist to try in on a bite record to make dentures. The patient complains that his cheeks feel full. What should be done to handle the patient's complaint in the above scenario?

answer.text: Opening the wax base covering the artificial teeth
Reducing the labiobuccal thickness of the biting girdle

name.text: REMEDIAL UJIAN AKHIR MK. BLOK GNATOLOGI 1 KELAS INTERNASIONAL

questiontext.text: A 60-year-old man came to the General Hospital with complaints of difficulty chewing food because he had no teeth. The patient wants dentures made. After going through several stages, the dentist will then arrange the posterior teeth, namely the maxillary first molars. What is the dentist's guide in arranging the artificial in the above case?

answer.text: Only the mesio-buccal cusp touches the occlusal plane
All cusps touch the occlusal plane, the tooth axis is perpendicular to the vertical plane
Only the mesio-palatal cusp touches the occlusal plane
Only the palatal cusps touch the occlusal plane
All cusps touch the occlusal plane, the tooth axis is more distal to the vertical plane

name.text: REMEDIAL UJIAN AKHIR MK. BLOK GNATOLOGI 1 KELAS INTERNASIONAL

questiontext.text: A 60-year-old man came to the General Hospital with complaints of difficulty chewing food because he had no teeth. The patient wants dentures made. After going through several stages, the dentist will then arrange the teeth. During the arrangement of the upper and lower canines, the upper canines were made to touch the occlusal plane, the upper first premolars only had one cusp, the first and second molars were made slowly not to touch the occlusal plane. What compensation curve will the dentist draw up?

name.text: REMEDIAL UJIAN AKHIR MK. BLOK GNATOLOGI 1 KELAS INTERNASIONAL

questiontext.text: A 60-year-old man comes to the General Hospital with complaints of difficulty chewing food because he has no teeth. The patient wants dentures made. After going through several stages, the dentist will then select artificial teeth for the patient. Dentists want to display a firm character according to the patient's personality to their dentures. What should the dentist pay attention to in this scenario?

answer.text: Selecting an anterior artificial tooth with an angled mesio/distal incisal angle.
Selecting an anterior artificial tooth that is mesio/distal-incisal rounded

name.text: REMEDIAL UJIAN AKHIR MK. BLOK GNATOLOGI 1 KELAS INTERNASIONAL

questiontext.text: A 50-year-old woman came to the RSGMP and want to have a removable denture. At this visit, the dentist will perform the installation of dentures in the oral cavity. The dentist will assess the natural appearance of the denture. What can be done to get it ?

answer.text: Changing the anterior position performed in the dental lab
Made according to the wishes of clinicians only
The incisal ridge is still complete with Mamelo

questiontext.text: After try in on the patient, the model is processed in the laboratory. What is the name of the stage in the picture?

answer.text: Figure 3 is the model after boiling out
The Figure 3 stage is carried out first than the Figure 1 stage
Figure 4 is the antagonist cuvette has been closed following immersion with dental stone
Figure 2 is a mandibular denture smeared with cold mold seal
Figure 1 is a model of the maxilla buried in the base cuvette

name.text: REMEDIAL UJIAN AKHIR MK. BLOK GNATOLOGI 1 KELAS INTERNASIONAL

questiontext.text: A denture model before being processed by acrylic, then goes through several stages. What is the name of the stage in the picture?

answer.text: Figure c is the installation stage of artificial teeth
Figure b is the stage of immersing the model in the cuvette
Picture d is the stage of applying the plaster model with vaseline
The stage of Figure b is carried out first than the stage of Figure d
Picture a is the boiling out stage

name.text: REMEDIAL UJIAN AKHIR MK. BLOK GNATOLOGI 1 KELAS INTERNASIONAL

questiontext.text: In the manufacture of removable dentures, after the acrylic process, the denture is removed from the cuvette and the excess acrylic is cut off. What is the name of the stage referred to in the scenario?

questiontext.text: A 67-year-old female patient came to the RSGMP and want to have a new denture. questiontext.text: A removable denture ready for insertion must be polished. What is done at the stage referred to in the scenario?

answer.text: Rough parts of the anatomic surface should be removed
Grinding the long edge of the base
Using the brush wheel to form the curves of the rugae

questiontext.text: A dentist will place a removable denture on a patient. During the try-in, several examinations were carried out to check whether the removable denture was easily detached. Was the check carried out as stated in the scenario?

answer.text: The examination is carried out 1 week after the denture is installed
Examination by pressing one side of the denture

questiontext.text: In examining the extent of the denture base, several assessments were carried out. What to check according to the scenario?

answer.text: Correction of over-extension by increasing wing length
An important posterior extension of the GT is the labial frenulum
Mark overextension: release GT and make sudden movement
Under-extension is seen in the mouth when the sulcus depth is seen to be deeper than the GT flank

questiontext.text: A 62-year-old woman came to the prosthodontic clinic with complaints of damaged dentures, after taking a history and clinical examination it was found that the dentures were damaged due to construction errors. What is the etiology of the mistake in case above ?

answer.text: Arrangement of teeth outside the alveolar ridge
